channel.title: Mapping: Falling foliage and such
channel.description:
Can someone tell me please, how this is implemented?
You see this effect in CS:S and L4D for example. Is it a kind of a dynamic prop?
Thanks for answer!

item.title: Mapping: Falling foliage and such
item.dc:creator: Ulti
item.description:
Why not?
I saw an older particle benchmark on youtube for example and there it was already possible.
I think you only have to create the particle effects for it.

Btw: Thanks for the links!

Read full topic

item.title: Mapping: Falling foliage and such
item.dc:creator: Chrillen
item.description:
I don’t think it’s possible without coding.

If you still want to try it, then this link is rather useful (although there were still some problems):

https://www.interlopers.net/forum/viewtopic.php?f=25&t=28306&hilit=rain

You can also make custom particle effect, there’s a tutorial for that here:

https://www.interlopers.net/forum/viewtopic.php?f=16&t=24648&hilit=rain&start=15

Read full topic

item.title: Mapping: Falling foliage and such
item.dc:creator: Ulti
item.description:
Thank you!

By the way: Is it also possible to make a similar rain splash effect like in L4D with this particle editor (without coding)?
So that you have splashes on normal textures and props and waves on puddles?

Read full topic

item.title: Mapping: Falling foliage and such
item.dc:creator: Ulti
item.description:
Thanks!

Chrillen:

You are referring to the falling leaves, right?

Exactly!

Do you know a tutorial?

Read full topic

item.title: Mapping: Falling foliage and such
item.dc:creator: Chrillen
item.description:
It’s a particle effect if I’m not much mistaken. At least in L4D, can’t seem to remember any in CS: S.

You are referring to the falling leaves, right?

Read full topic
